name: Kepler-142
scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-142 Exoplanetary System

Kepler-142 is a star with 1.6039999999999999 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.27 times its radius. It is located 1818.35 light years away from the solar system.

Kepler-142 is known to have 3 exoplanets in orbit around it.

Kepler-142 b

Kepler-142 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.03 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 2.02 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-142.

The mass of Kepler-142 b is 5.05 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-142 b is 1.99 that of Earth. At 5.05 Earth masses, Kepler-142 b is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.

Kepler-142 c

Kepler-142 c was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.06 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 4.76 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-142.

The mass of Kepler-142 c is 11.96 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-142 c is 2.86 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, Kepler-142 c is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.

Kepler-142 d

Kepler-142 d was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.24 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 41.81 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-142.

The mass of Kepler-142 d is 6.13 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-142 d is 2.16 that of Earth. At 6.13 Earth masses, Kepler-142 d is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-142, which contains 3 planets and was discovered by Kepler.
